intro: Tachiadenus tubiflorus, commonly known as the woolly tachiadenus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
